statement:
Let $F,F_1,F_2,\dots$ be distribution functions. If $F_n$ converges to
$F$, then
$$\int_\mathbb{R} g(x)dF_n(x) \xrightarrow[n\rightarrow\infty]{}
\int_\mathbb{R} g(x)dF(x)$$ for each continuous bounded function
$g:\mathbb{R}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}$.

*Remark.* The integrals involved are Riemann-Stieltjes integrals.
